content.question: A toy car of mass <math alttext="m equals 4 kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>kg</mi></math> accelerates across a surface in a straight line. The kinetic energy of the car increases from <math alttext="8 joules" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>8</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi></math> to <math alttext="18 joules" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>18</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi></math> while the car is accelerating. What is the change in the momentum of the car?

choices.label: <math alttext="1 kilogram meter per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>kg</mi><mo>·</mo><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="4 kilogram meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>kg</mi><mo>·</mo><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="8 kilogram meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>8</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>kg</mi><mo>·</mo><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="12 kilogram meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>12</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>kg</mi><mo>·</mo><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="4 kilogram meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>kg</mi><mo>·</mo><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
